summary: usain bolt will compete at the iaaf/btc world relays in the bahamas next month , the jamaica athletics administrative association has announced . the six-time olympic gold medallist will compete at the relay championship on may 2 and 3 as part of the jamaican team . usain bolt has confirmed he will be part of jamaica 's team at the world relays in the bahamas .

Jamaica has a long-standing and successful tradition in relays, especially in 4x100m and 4x400m races. This reputation has been built on the back of their dominant performances at international competitions, such as the IAAF World Championships and the Olympic Games. Jamaica's relay teams have consistently won medals in these competitions, with their success largely driven by the talented pool of sprinters from the country, including Usain Bolt, who has previously competed in the 4x100m and 4x400m relay events. Jamaica's success in relays has become synonymous with the country's track and field program and is a significant factor in the country's reputation as a powerhouse in sprinting and relay races.
